title: Cuban Ballplayers Await Word on Visas
body:
Four Cuban baseball players held at an immigrant center in the Bahamas awaited a formal invitation from Costa 
Rica offering refuge.

The players hoped to receive word soon that Costa Rica had granted humanitarian visas, said associates of a 
Miami-based Cuban-American sports agent working to free the players. The four fled Communist-ruled Cuba on a 
small boat last week.

Officials at the detention center said Tuesday that more than 150 Cubans held there had gone on a hunger strike to 
protest alleged preferential treatment given to the baseball players.
